From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: allergie

German

[edit]
German Wikipedia has an article on:
Allergie
Wikipedia de

Etymology

[edit]

Coined by Austrian physician Clemens von Pirquet in 1906, from Ancient Greek ἄλλος (állos, “other”) +‎ Ancient Greek ἔργον (érgon, “work, activity”), on the model of Energie.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -iː

Noun

[edit]

Allergie f (genitive Allergie, plural Allergien)

  1. (pathology, immunology) allergy

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Allergie [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Allergie die Allergien
genitive einer der Allergie der Allergien
dative einer der Allergie den Allergien
accusative eine die Allergie die Allergien
